turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Wading in the Water.
turn.1: What is Wading in the Water?
turn.2: Wading in the Water Wading in the Water is a 2007 mixed media collage by artist India Cruse-Griffin located on the Eskenazi Health campus, near downtown Indianapolis, Indiana, and is part of the Eskenazi Health Art Collection.
turn.4: "Wading in the Water" is a 2007 mixed media collage by artist India Cruse-Griffin, which depicts a young woman in a pink dress in front of a tree-lined bank, waist deep in a body of water, reaching down to grab a fish.
turn.5: What are some of the materials used to make the collage?
turn.6: The work, which measures 37.25" x 49.25", framed, is made from collaged paper gathered from magazines, upon which Cruse-Griffin then paints, often allowing the underlying magazine paper to show through.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: While her subjects are often clear and straightforward, this collage technique serves as a reminder of the accumulation of lived experience.
turn.10: "Wading in the Water" was acquired by Eskenazi Health as part of a re-imagining of the organization's historical art collection and to support "the sense of optimism, vitality and energy" of its new campus in 2013.
turn.11: Was there a reason why it was acquired?
turn.12: In response to its nationwide request for proposals, Eskenazi Health received more than 500 submissions from 39 states, which were then narrowed to 54 finalists by an independent jury.
